metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000001 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high
metadata.description:
In glibc 2.26 and earlier there is confusion in the usage of getcwd() byrealpath() which can be used to write before the destination buffer leadingto a buffer underflow and potential code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

glibc-source - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc-bin - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-amd64 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-armel - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-i386 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-pic - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-ppc64 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-s390 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
libc6-x32 - 2.23-0ubuntu10
locales - 2.23-0ubuntu10
locales-all - 2.23-0ubuntu10
multiarch-support - 2.23-0ubuntu10
nscd - 2.23-0ubuntu10
No subscription required

musl - 1.1.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
musl-tools - 1.1.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glibc package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.23-0ubuntu10').
musl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.1.9-1ubuntu0.1~esm2').
